intro: Cecropia putumayonis, commonly known as the giant cecropia, is a fast-growing tree native to the tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its large, palmately lobed leaves and distinctive, hollow stems that are often covered in stinging hairs. The plant is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is known for its ability to thrive in disturbed habitats. It produces small, greenish flowers that are followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Cecropia putumayonis plays an important ecological role, providing shelter and food for various animals in its native environment.
